pull_request.title: Adds encoding options for subjectPublicKey and privateKey
pull_request.body:
Integrates encoding subjectPublicKey and privateKey according the following IETF drafts:

https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-uni-qsckeys-dilithium/00/
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-uni-qsckeys-falcon/00/
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-uni-qsckeys-kyber/00/
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-uni-qsckeys-sphincsplus/00/

- Integrates encoding library from https://github.com/Quantum-Safe-Collaboration/qsc-key-rfc/tree/main/qsc-key-encoder.
The code is used as an external project with cmake `ExternalProject_Add`. Optionally, oqs-provider can be built without the dependency by using `-DUSE_ENCODING_LIB=OFF`. The library provides API to encode/decode according to the draft specification.

- The encodings are specified by setting environment variables. Example: `export OQS_ENCODING_DILITHIUM2=draft-uni-qsckeys-dilithium-00/sk-pk`. If no env variable are set, the default is 'no' encoding (the previous oqs-provider behavior).

- Supports the `-DNOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY` build option (#83). 
Note: some PQC algorithms (Kyber, SPHINCS+) already contain the public key in their 'raw' private key. With `-DNOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY=OFF`, this usually leads to an unnecessary duplication of the public key. The encodings according to the IETF drafts avoid this duplication even if `-DNOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY=OFF`.

- Adds CI test runs (with / without encodings set, with / without NOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY)

Will add config options to Wiki if merged.

Fixes #89

comment.body: Should this not be #ifdef'd (dependent on USE_ENCODING_LIB)?

https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-uni-qsckeys-dilithium/00/

- Integrates encoding library from https://github.com/Quantum-Safe-Collaboration/qsc-key-rfc/tree/main/qsc-key-encoder.
The code is used as an external project with cmake `ExternalProject_Add`. Optionally, oqs-provider can be built without the dependency by using `-DUSE_ENCODING_LIB=OFF`. The library provides API to encode/decode according to the draft specification.

- The encodings are specified by setting environment variables. Example: `export OQS_ENCODING_DILITHIUM2=draft-uni-qsckeys-dilithium-00/sk-pk`. If no env variable are set, the default is 'no' encoding (the previous oqs-provider behavior).

- Supports the `-DNOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY` build option (#83). 
Note: some PQC algorithms (Kyber, SPHINCS+) already contain the public key in their 'raw' private key. With `-DNOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY=OFF`, this usually leads to an unnecessary duplication of the public key. The encodings according to the IETF drafts avoid this duplication even if `-DNOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY=OFF`.

- Adds CI test runs (with / without encodings set, with / without NOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY)

Will add config options to Wiki if merged.

Fixes #89

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -25,11 +25,20 @@
 #define OQS_PROVIDER_BASE_VERSION_STR OQSPROVIDER_VERSION_TEXT
 
 #ifdef NOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY
-#define OQS_PROVIDER_VERSION_STR OQS_PROVIDER_BASE_VERSION_STR "-nopub"
+#define NOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY_STR "-nopub"
 #else
-#define OQS_PROVIDER_VERSION_STR OQS_PROVIDER_BASE_VERSION_STR
+#define NOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY_STR ""
 #endif
 
+#ifdef USE_ENCODING_LIB
+#define ENCODING_LIB_STR "-encoding_support"
+#else
+#define ENCODING_LIB_STR ""
+#endif
+
+#define OQS_PROVIDER_VERSION_STR OQS_PROVIDER_BASE_VERSION_STR NOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY_STR ENCODING_LIB_STR
comment.body: OK - I asked for it -- but isn't this a bit "too much"? Presence of encoding support is already shown in line 469, right? Preferably we can drop this (as well as "-nopub" (would be nice if we could achieve agreement on this soon -- not duplicating the public key in the private key could be default as far as I'm concerned: What's your take, @dstebila @bhess? If I'm not mistaken, this behaviour is no default only because we wanted interoperability between oqs-openssl111 and oqs-provider -- but we may slowly want to drop that, right?)

comment.body: Right, this is unused if USE_ENCODING_LIB is not set. Updated with ifdefs.

pull_request.title: Adds encoding options for subjectPublicKey and privateKey
pull_request.body:
Integrates encoding subjectPublicKey and privateKey according the following IETF drafts:

https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-uni-qsckeys-dilithium/00/
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-uni-qsckeys-falcon/00/
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-uni-qsckeys-kyber/00/
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-uni-qsckeys-sphincsplus/00/

- Integrates encoding library from https://github.com/Quantum-Safe-Collaboration/qsc-key-rfc/tree/main/qsc-key-encoder.
The code is used as an external project with cmake `ExternalProject_Add`. Optionally, oqs-provider can be built without the dependency by using `-DUSE_ENCODING_LIB=OFF`. The library provides API to encode/decode according to the draft specification.

- The encodings are specified by setting environment variables. Example: `export OQS_ENCODING_DILITHIUM2=draft-uni-qsckeys-dilithium-00/sk-pk`. If no env variable are set, the default is 'no' encoding (the previous oqs-provider behavior).

- Supports the `-DNOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY` build option (#83). 
Note: some PQC algorithms (Kyber, SPHINCS+) already contain the public key in their 'raw' private key. With `-DNOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY=OFF`, this usually leads to an unnecessary duplication of the public key. The encodings according to the IETF drafts avoid this duplication even if `-DNOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY=OFF`.

- Adds CI test runs (with / without encodings set, with / without NOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY)

Will add config options to Wiki if merged.

Fixes #89

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -25,11 +25,20 @@
 #define OQS_PROVIDER_BASE_VERSION_STR OQSPROVIDER_VERSION_TEXT
 
 #ifdef NOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY
-#define OQS_PROVIDER_VERSION_STR OQS_PROVIDER_BASE_VERSION_STR "-nopub"
+#define NOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY_STR "-nopub"
 #else
-#define OQS_PROVIDER_VERSION_STR OQS_PROVIDER_BASE_VERSION_STR
+#define NOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY_STR ""
 #endif
 
+#ifdef USE_ENCODING_LIB
+#define ENCODING_LIB_STR "-encoding_support"
+#else
+#define ENCODING_LIB_STR ""
+#endif
+
+#define OQS_PROVIDER_VERSION_STR OQS_PROVIDER_BASE_VERSION_STR NOPUBKEY_IN_PRIVKEY_STR ENCODING_LIB_STR
comment.body:
Removed the redundant string now (also -nopub).

Re. public key in private key: I imagine it can be useful to be able to get the public key directly from a PKCS#8 structure, e.g. for a signer who wants to test sign/verify without regenerating the pk. An advantage of the IETF drafts implemented in this PR is that the private keys are structured to have an OPTIONAL public key. If one choses to include the OPTIONAL part, there won't be a duplication of the public key. If one just concatenates the raw sk/pk, there will be duplication in some cases like Kyber/SPHINCS+.
